Sentencas: Oxide-ion and proton conductors have found diverse applications such as in electrolytes of solid-oxide, proton-conducting, and hybrid-ion fuel cells.
Titulo: Dimer-Mediated Cooperative Mechanism of Ultrafast-Ion Conduction in Hexagonal Perovskite-Related Oxides

Sentencas: Research of fuel cells with higher energy efficiency at lower operating temperature has stimulated the search for ion conductors and improved the understanding of the ion-diffusion mechanism.
Titulo: Dimer-Mediated Cooperative Mechanism of Ultrafast-Ion Conduction in Hexagonal Perovskite-Related Oxides

Sentencas: Ion conduction in hexagonal perovskite-related materials is rare, and the mechanism of ion diffusion is unclear.
Titulo: Dimer-Mediated Cooperative Mechanism of Ultrafast-Ion Conduction in Hexagonal Perovskite-Related Oxides

Sentencas: Herein, we report high oxide-ion and proton conductivity (bulk conductivities in wet air: 11 and 2.7 mS cm(-1) at 537 and 326 degrees C, respectively), high chemical, and electrical stability in a new hexagonal perovskite-related oxide Ba7Nb3.8Mo1.2O20.1.
Titulo: Dimer-Mediated Cooperative Mechanism of Ultrafast-Ion Conduction in Hexagonal Perovskite-Related Oxides

Sentencas: Total direct current conductivity at 400 degrees C in wet air of Ba7Nb3.8Mo1.2O20.1 was 13 times higher than that of Ba7Nb4MoO20.
Titulo: Dimer-Mediated Cooperative Mechanism of Ultrafast-Ion Conduction in Hexagonal Perovskite-Related Oxides

Sentencas: We also report a unique dimer-mediated cooperative mechanism of the high oxide-ion conduction of Ba7Nb3.8Mo1.2O20.1 (bulk conductivities in dry air: 10 mS cm(-1) at 593 degrees C and 1.1 mS cm(-1) at 306 degrees C).
Titulo: Dimer-Mediated Cooperative Mechanism of Ultrafast-Ion Conduction in Hexagonal Perovskite-Related Oxides

Sentencas: Ab initio molecular dynamics (AIMD) simulations, neutron-diffraction experiments at 800 degrees C, and neutron scattering length density analyses of Ba7Nb3.8Mo1.2O20.1 indicated that the excess oxygen atoms are incorporated by the formation of both 5-fold coordinated (Nb/Mo)O-5 monomer and its (Nb/Mo)(2)O-9 dimer with a corner-sharing oxygen atom and that the breaking and reforming of the dimers lead to the high oxide-ion conduction in the oxygen-deficient BaO2.1 c ' layer.
Titulo: Dimer-Mediated Cooperative Mechanism of Ultrafast-Ion Conduction in Hexagonal Perovskite-Related Oxides

Sentencas: The long distance between Nb/Mo and Ba cations sandwiching the c ' layer of Ba7Nb3.8Mo1.2O20.1 was found to be responsible for its low activation energy for oxide-ion conduction, leading to high conductivity at low temperatures.
Titulo: Dimer-Mediated Cooperative Mechanism of Ultrafast-Ion Conduction in Hexagonal Perovskite-Related Oxides

Sentencas: AIMD simulations showed that high proton conduction can be attributed to proton migration in the hexagonal close-packed BaO3 layers of Ba7Nb3.8Mo1.2O20.1.
Titulo: Dimer-Mediated Cooperative Mechanism of Ultrafast-Ion Conduction in Hexagonal Perovskite-Related Oxides

Sentencas: The present findings hold a great promise for the development and design of ion conductors.
Titulo: Dimer-Mediated Cooperative Mechanism of Ultrafast-Ion Conduction in Hexagonal Perovskite-Related Oxides
